text: <@U66GD0880>, <@U67461GUB> and the Julia community in general for their explosive initiative and creativity. I was wondering with <@U8MPCDJAY> in <#CB8A1RNCE|static-compilation> why MKL.jl has stopped working from 1.6 onward, and timidly pinged <@U66GD0880> to ask if we can now distribute MKL-compiled Julia binaries, who pinged <@U67461GUB>, who, together with <@U67D54KS8> and <@U8MPCDJAY>, concluded that what we need is a way to switch arbitrary BLAS libraries on the fly, with performance and in any platform. They then proceeded, during the following few hours, to exchange around a hundred slack messages, opened a new repo with a proof of concept for a switchable BLAS design and began to explore how to link Julia against it to be able to activate the MKL library on the fly. It was fascinating to watch. I am so floored by this community!
